title: Procurement overview
line1: Follow the process below to create your procurement. Each stage can be saved and resumed at any time.
line2: You can download and save what you enter to your own system.
line3: You cannot run step 2 and 3 at the same time.
line4: Check the terms and conditions of this lot in the

sections: Every supplier is checked to make sure they can supply the products or services offered by the commercial agreement.

You can ask suppliers questions before formally publishing your requirements to find out about products and services, or refine your needs. For the lot you selected, you can do pre-market engagement in one of the following ways:

Request for Information (RfI)
Gather information for your project from suppliers about the products and services they offer, and the commercial terms needed to buy them.



This section is optional, if you are ready to write and publish your requirements you can go to the next step. If you would like to do pre-market engagement you can click the button below.
subsections: Gather information for your project from suppliers about the products and services they offer, and the commercial terms needed to buy them.
This section is optional, if you are ready to write and publish your requirements you can go to the next step.

sections: Write and publish your bid pack for suppliers, who can then submit their responses to your requirements and complete any other evaluation tasks set by you.
You will need a clear set of criteria that suppliers will need to meet, and be evaluated against. You will also need to include how you will score their responses.
For the lot you selected, you can run your procurement in one of the following ways:
You will need to invite all suppliers to bid for your opportunity and assess all bids that are submitted.
This is also known as one-stage further competition.

You must evaluate the suppliers to find the one that best meets your requirements.

You should use the methods and criteria you published with your requirements to assess and score suppliers.

You can then award a contract to your preferred supplier.
When you have completed your evaluation and found a suitable supplier, you can award your contract.
You will need to give feedback to any unsuccessful suppliers.
You need to publish the contract on Contracts Finder. This is a legal requirement.

content.text: Digital Specialists and Programmes, Lot 2: Specialists
